issue.title: [CF 1162] properly tracking pvp trinkets
issue.body:
^1^T^SShowTimer^B ^SType^Sunitcooldown ^SName^SPvP~`Trinket:~`2:00;~`Every~`Man~`for~`Himself:~`2:00 ^SGUID^STMW:icon:1L_Pdhhl3_kc ^SShowWhen^N3 ^SUnit^Starget ^SEnabled^B ^t^N73501^S~`~| ^Sicon^^

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1.
2.
3.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
Trying to have the icon track both a pvp trinket/the human racial, but it only puts whatever cooldown was entered first into the box and won't track the other.  If I have it so it has 2 columns instead of one then it works fine, but it defeats the purpose because then one icon is isn't going to be active unless a human equips a pvp trinket and uses it. Or If I'm tracking a non-human target, I'd have the human racial sitting there which wouldn't be triggered ever as they're not human.

...They both work, I just can't track both of them with only one icon, as they overlap each other and won't change the icon based on what was used. Having it as a group controller doesn't help.

I realize that having usable unchecked remedies the situation, but I want the icon to always show whether or not it is on a cooldown.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)

v7.3.5
Do you have an error log of what happened?
No.

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)

Also... I was wondering if it was possible to have some sort of lua that would ignore player as a target for tracking said cd, because if I use @party1 it just takes whoever is in the first slot, but I want the icon to ignore showing it if it's for @player.

... or simply just a way to make it so that my raid frame doesn't show while having raid frames up would work, but that's not really tellmewhen orientated.
